alert.note: Alert for Blue Earth; Waseca (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 7:04PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Blue Earth and southwestern Waseca Counties through 800 PM CDT... At 704 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Good Thunder, or 13 miles south of Mankato, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Mapleton around 715 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include St. Clair and Pemberton. This includes U.S. Highway 14 near mile marker 145. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
